result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Armando Santiago-Rivera in court with attorney Debra J Patterson for Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Armando Santiago-Rivera in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant is entering the DTC/DPA on case(s): 15CM2574, 15CM2015 and 15CM1897.  On motion of the State, Court ordered Counts 1 AND 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN FOR THE PURPOSES OF SENTENCING.
By agreement of the Parties,  matter is rescheduled to 01-27-2016 at 02:30pm.  sdg

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Armando Santiago-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has been accepted into Drug Treatment Court but continues to wait on space to become available.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Armando Santiago-Rivera not in court, defendant in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Gabriela Leija is not available today.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, Defendant Armando Santiago-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick n Save on National Ave. in West Allis
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.

Defendant Armando Santiago-Rivera in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-037

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. 
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 24.
Clerk:  jms
Previously sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/24/15 @ 1:30 pm
